context_bundle.summary: Go performance optimization with pprof profiling, escape analysis, memory optimization, and performance best practices

onboarding.quick_start: go test -cpuprofile=cpu.prof -memprofile=mem.prof -bench=. && go tool pprof cpu.prof
common_patterns: CPU profiling: 'import _ "net/http/pprof"; go func() { log.Println(http.ListenAndServe("localhost:6060", nil)) }()' then visit http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/
Memory profiling: 'go test -memprofile=mem.prof -bench=. && go tool pprof -alloc_space mem.prof'
Escape analysis: 'go build -gcflags="-m" main.go' to see allocations
Avoid allocations: 'var buf [64]byte; s := string(buf[:n])' use stack instead of heap
String builder: 'var sb strings.Builder; sb.WriteString("hello"); s := sb.String()' for concatenation
Sync.Pool: 'var pool = sync.Pool{New: func() interface{} { return new(bytes.Buffer) }}; buf := pool.Get().(*bytes.Buffer); defer pool.Put(buf)'
Inline functions: Keep functions small for inlining, check with 'go build -gcflags="-m"'
Benchmarking: 'func BenchmarkFunction(b *testing.B) { b.ResetTimer(); for i := 0; i < b.N; i++ { function() } }'
known_errors: high memory usage: Profile with pprof, check for goroutine leaks with 'go tool pprof http://localhost:6060/debug/pprof/goroutine'
slow performance: Profile CPU with pprof, optimize hot paths identified
GC pressure: Reduce allocations, use sync.Pool for frequently allocated objects
escape to heap: Refactor to keep data on stack, avoid returning pointers to local variables
benchmark variance: Run with -count=10, use benchstat for statistical analysis
pprof not working: Ensure import _ "net/http/pprof" and server running
